00023 void printByte(ostream& stream, unsigned char byte)
00024 {
00025     stream << hex << showbase << static_cast<unsigned int>(byte) << dec;

00033 unsigned int countBitOne(unsigned char b)
00034 {
00035     unsigned int result = 0;
00036 
00037     for(unsigned char mask = 0x80; mask>0; mask>>=1)
00038     {
00039         if((b & mask) == 0)
00040             break;
00041 
00042         ++result;
00043     }
00044 
00045     return result;
00046 }

00076 unsigned int JMA_CType_UTF8::getByteCount(const char* p) const
00077 {
00078         assert(p);
00079 
00080         const unsigned char* uc = (const unsigned char*)p; // byte sequence
00081     const unsigned char first = uc[0]; // the first byte
00082     const unsigned int bitCount = countBitOne(first); // count of the continuous bit 1 in the first byte
00083     unsigned int result = 0;
00084 
00085     switch(bitCount)
00086     {
00087     case 0:
00088         if(first == 0)
00089             result = 0; // NULL
00090         else
00091             result = 1; // ASCII
00092 
00093         break;
00094 
00095     case 1:
00096         cerr << "invalid byte: ";
00097         printByte(cerr, first);
00098         cerr << ", it could only be the second, third or fourth byte of a multi-byte sequence of UTF-8." << endl;
00099         result = 1; // ignore the invalid byte
00100         break;
00101 
00102     case 2:
00103         // check the first byte in 2-byte sequence
00104         if(first == 0xC0 || first == 0xC1)
00105         {
00106             cerr << "invalid byte: ";
00107             printByte(cerr, first);
00108             cerr << ", it is a start of 2-byte sequence, but its code point is less than 0x80." << endl;
00109             result = 1; // ignore the invalid byte
00110             break;
00111         }
00112     case 3:
00113     case 4:
00114         // check the subsequent bytes
00115         for(unsigned int i=1; i<bitCount; ++i)
00116         {
00117             if(uc[i] == 0 || countBitOne(uc[i]) != 1)
00118             {
00119                 cerr << "invalid byte: ";
00120                 printByte(cerr, first);
00121                 cerr << ", it is followed by the " << i << "th byte: ";
00122                 printByte(cerr, uc[i]);
00123                 cerr << " in a multi-byte sequnce of UTF-8." << endl;
00124                 result = 1; // ignore the invalid byte
00125                 break;
00126             }
00127         }
00128         if(result == 1)
00129         {
00130             break;
00131         }
00132 
00133         // check the first byte in 4-byte sequence
00134         if(first >= 0xF5 && first <= 0xF7)
00135         {
00136             cerr << "invalid byte: ";
00137             printByte(cerr, first);
00138             cerr << ", it is a start of 4-byte sequence, but its code point is above 0x10FFFF." << endl;
00139             result = 1; // ignore the invalid byte
00140             break;
00141         }
00142 
00143         result = bitCount;
00144         break;
00145 
00146     default:
00147         cerr << "invalid byte: ";
00148         printByte(cerr, first);
00149         cerr << ", it is not defined in a multi-byte sequnce of UTF-8." << endl;
00150         result = 1; // ignore the invalid byte
00151         break;
00152     }
00153 
00154     return result;
00155 }

00157 bool JMA_CType_UTF8::isSpace(const char* p) const
00158 {
00159     assert(p);
00160 
00161     const unsigned char* uc = (const unsigned char*)p;
00162 
00163     if(uc[0] < 0x80)
00164         return isspace(uc[0]); // check by std library
00165 
00166     //full-width space in UTF-8
00167     if(getByteCount(p) == 3 && uc[0] == 0xE3 && uc[1] == 0x80 && uc[2] == 0x80)
00168         return true;
00169 
00170     return false;
00171 }

00173 string JMA_CType_UTF8::replaceSpaces(const char* str, char replacement)
00174 {
00175         unsigned char replace = (unsigned char)replacement;
00176         const unsigned char* uc = (const unsigned char*)str;
00177         string ret(str);
00178         unsigned char* c2 = (unsigned char*)ret.data();
00179 
00180     const unsigned int length = ret.size();
00181     for(unsigned int i=0; i<length;)
00182         {
00183                 if(uc[i] < 0x80)
00184                 {
00185                         if(isspace(uc[i]))
00186                                 c2[i] = replace;
00187 
00188                         ++i;
00189                 }
00190         else
00191         {
00192             int bytesCount = getByteCount((const char*)uc);
00193 
00194             //full-width space in UTF-8
00195             if(bytesCount == 3)
00196             {
00197                 if((uc[i] == 0xE3 && uc[i+1] == 0x80 && uc[i+2] == 0x80) ||
00198                         (uc[i] == 0xEF && uc[i+1] == 0xBB && uc[i+2] == 0xBF))
00199                 {
00200                     c2[i] = c2[i+1] = c2[i+2] = replace;
00201                 }
00202             }
00203 
00204             i += bytesCount;
00205         }
00206         }
00207 
00208         return ret;
00209 }
